title: Killian
text:
CV
  
  
    
     Email
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Twitter
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  

  
  


I am a Senior Economist at the Irish Fiscal Advisory Council. I am a doctoral candidate in economics at University College Dublin. My research focuses interests are in macroeconomics and fiscal policy.



PhD in Economics | University College Dublin | Ongoing
MSc in Quantitative Economics | University College Dublin | 2018
BSc in Economics and Mathematical Sciences | University of Limerick | 2017

title: Research
text: My research focuses on macroeconomics and fiscal policy.

title: Research
text: My research focuses on macroeconomics and fiscal policy.

title: Research
text:
Publications

Peer-Reviewed Journal Articles
1.Killian Carroll (2022). Free State to tax State: A century of taxation in Ireland. Economic and Social Review, Volume(53), No. 1, Spring 2022. PDF


Working papers

Killian Carroll (2024). What climate change means for Ireland’s public finances. Irish Fiscal Advisory Council Working paper series, Dublin. PDF
Killian Carroll, Eddie Casey, (2023). What climate change means for Ireland’s public finances. Irish Fiscal Advisory Council Working paper series, Dublin. PDF
Killian Carroll, Sebastian Barnes, (2023). Saving for Ireland’s Future: Building a Sustainable Framework to Fund the State Pension. Irish Fiscal Advisory Council Working paper series, Dublin. PDF
Killian Carroll (2020). Forecasting Ireland’s Macroeconomy: A Large Bayesian VAR Approach. Irish Fiscal Advisory Council Working paper series, Dublin. PDF
